page.title: 18 The Village School
page.content: The Village School,built in 1876 with three rooms,started life with 112 children of all ages,many only three years old.By 1945 the number on roll had dropped to 18,up to 11 years old.In 1974 the school became a first school for children from 5 to 9 years. The roll is now 51 children.Some children are transported to school by mini-bus,and hot meals are brought to the Village Hall at midday from Stoke by Nayland Middle School a mile away.Recent innovations in the school have included a computer,calculators, a video-cassette recorder,and large physical education apparatus(kept and used in the new Village Hall.) Playing in the playground,I have fun, Even if it's kiss chase,I have fun, Even if it's "it",I have fun. by Bonnie Halsall, aged 8 years.
